page.title: 15KINGSCLERE FIRE BRIGADE
page.content: In Kingsclere the Fire Brigade use a water tender fire engine which carries 1800 litres of water, a 30 foot ladder, a shorter ladder, a roof ladder, 16 lengths of hose, 2 small hose reels and breathing apparatus. There are 14 firemen, but only five or six go to each call. They are retained firemen, which means that they have another job to do. They carry a bleeper which calls them out to fires. The station covers an area of 60 sq. miles. The commonest type of fire in 1984 was chimney fires. The fire brigade also go out to road accidents if someone is trapped or if a lorry has a dangerous load. The total number of turnouts in 1984 was 142. Most incidents occurred between 16.00 and 17.00 The station is run by Hampshire Fire Brigade.
